Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech and should be withdrawn.

The Bill breaches international human rights standards, specifically Article 19 of the ICCPR.
The Bill lacks transparency and accountability, with no public reporting requirements for censorship activities.
Compliance costs for digital platforms may lead to broad censorship practices.
